noInvalidUseBeforeDeclaration.description:
Description

Disallow the use of variables, function parameters, classes, and enums before their declaration
JavaScript doesn’t allow the use of block-scoped variables (let,const), function parameters, and classes before their declaration.
Similarly TypeScript doesn’t allow the use of enums before their declaration.
AReferenceErrorwill be thrown with any attempt to access the variable or the parameter before its declaration.
The rule also reports the use of variables declared withvarbefore their declarations.
noInvalidUseBeforeDeclaration.option: This rule has no specific options.
